intro: Allophylus pervillei f. pervillei, commonly known as the Perville's alpine hibiscus, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
